name: Abyss Hammer
notes:
Notes
This mysterious hammer is a very rare item since it can only be obtained in places hard to reach, such as some parts of The Inquisition Quest or deep in the Pits of Inferno.

name: Amber Bludgeon

attributes.Augments: Annihilation -> +14% critical extra damage, Annihilation -> -8s cooldown

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Amber Cudgel

attributes.Augments: Annihilation -> +14% critical extra damage, Annihilation -> -8s cooldown

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Amber Staff
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Arcane Staff
notes:
Notes
It looks the same as an Arcane Staff (Unknown) and Racoohan Rat Revealer.
Obtainable through The Pits of Inferno Quest.

name: Banana Staff
notes:
Notes
The best one-handed club available for players below level 20, tied in attack with Morning Star, but rarely used due to its rarity, price and readily availability of the former. The extra Defense Modifier is arguably very useful for lower levels.
Needed for an addon of Shaman Outfits.

name: Battle Hammer
notes:
Notes
Good Club Weapon for low to mid levels, but in the most cases a Morning Star is a better choice.
It looks the same as a Giant Smithhammer, a Hammer of Mighty Cheating and a Trunkhammer.
Reward in the Light House Quest.

name: Blessed Sceptre
notes:
Notes
This is a good one-handed Club Weapon for level 75 players. As long as you are also using a shield, this weapon compares favourably to both Justice Seeker and Royal Axe due to its lower weight.

Reward from the Barbarian Arena - Warlord Mode.

name: Bone Club
notes:
Notes
Not very useful. Considered a rare to some on Rookgaard. Part of Bone Set.

name: Bonebreaker
notes:
Notes
It has one more attack point than the War Hammer.

name: Brutetamer's Staff
notes:
Notes
A good, if not uncommon club weapon for lower levels. Oddly enough this weapon can look like its laying on the ground or standing up on its own when viewed from different angles.

name: Chaos Mace
notes:
Notes
Used to be rare, but later became more common and cheaper to buy with the introduction of Nightstalkers and Rashid.

name: Clerical Mace
notes:
Notes
Used to be quite popular with lower leveled players, now it is outclassed by other club weapons, such as Spiky Club and Furry Club. Nevertheless, players on a very tight budget should consider using them, specially for their Defense Modifier, at the offset of higher weight and lower attack.

name: Club of the Fury
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Boogey to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It's the lightest Club Weapon in the game together with the Stale Bread of Ancientness.
Looks the same as a Rolling Pin and a Rolling Pin (Rookgaard). It is likely a reference to the so-called "Mace of Fury" that is being sold by Bozo. This in itself is a reference to the legendary Sword of Fury.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Club
notes:
Notes
The starting weapon for those with no-vocation.  Should be replaced as soon as possible. Good for Training, just slightly worse than the Crowbar. If one intends to use this as a main weapon, those in Rookgaard or Dawnport are advised to look for better alternatives, such as Mace or Bone Club. While those in Mainland, intending to use Club Weapons, should seek a Morning Star or Battle Hammer.
Obtained in The Beginning Quest and the Flash Client Tutorial.

name: Cobra Club
notes:
Notes
This is the best one-handed fire weapon in the game. Particularly useful for places like Talahu, Carnivora's Rocks and Underground Glooth Factory. It is much cheaper than  the Eldritch Warmace and can be used in a combination with a shield, soaking extra damage.
In comparison to other weapon styles, it is better than the Summerblade, while sometimes costing less or the same. However, the Phantasmal Axe is seen as a much better cheaper alternative than the two, with much higher damage output but lesser defensive capabilities, since it is a two handed weapon.

name: Cranial Basher
notes:
Notes
A good one handed club weapon for players of level 60. However, lootable clubs such as the Metal Bat and the exceptional Deepling Squelcher present better options, with the later having only a level 48 requirement. Better to use it in as a second weapon with an elemental imbuement to kill physical resistant/immune creatures (such as Ghosts).
It can be obtained through The Ultimate Challenges Quest, Scrapper Level.

name: Crowbar
notes:
Notes
Crowbars can be used to fix or destroy certain objects. Also it is the lowest attack club and is good for Training.
Needed in one of The Postman Missions, in the The Ape City Quest, and for the In Service of Yalahar Quest. Unlocks a door in the Desert Dungeon. 
You can use the Whacking Driller of Fate as a substitution for this tool.

name: Crude Umbral Hammer
notes:
Notes
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Crude Umbral Mace
notes:
Notes
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Crystal Mace
notes:
Notes
Due to its stats and rarity compared to other weapons, this beautiful mace is used mainly as a valuable decoration, since it is a rare loot from only a few hard creatures.
It can be obtained from Mucus Plugs.

name: Daramian Mace
notes:
Notes
A player who joined in the knight vocation can choose this club in the attached cellar of the Island of Destiny. Often found lying around the Ankrahmun desert.

name: Dark Trinity Mace
notes:
Notes
The name of the item is an allusion to the Church of Zathroth. The Dark Trinity (Archpriest and two Tribunes) is its highest commission. Therefore, you might expect this weapon to appear as loot from further powerful demon bosses yet to appear in game.
It can currently be seen in Pythius The Rotten's treasure room; however, the mace is being covered by a Green Gem.
Before Gamemasters were dismissed, CipSoft gave them a list of items to choose as a token of their appreciation and this is one of the items that were on this list.

name: Deepling Squelcher
notes:
Notes
The stats for this weapon are hugely disproportionate considering its requirements. It is the strongest weapon available for players with level 48 or above, even superior (or equal) to two-handed weapons of its level across all melee weapon types.
Part of the Deepling Set.

name: Deepling Staff
notes:
Notes
Very little is currently known about this Weapon. Part of the Deepling Set.

name: Demonbone
notes:
Notes
Good one-handed club weapon. It was first looted on Candia by Darkseph. It is the heaviest weapon in the game, together with the Giant Sword and Twiceslicer. Mainly used as a deco due to it's value. Nowadays, on many Optional PvP worlds the price dropped drastically, due to the fact that Annihilon is hunted frequently there. It is still a very rare and valuable item on most servers due to Annihilon being hard to hunt on Open PvP and Hardcore PvP servers.

name: Diamond Sceptre
notes:
Notes
Best one handed club weapon for level 25.

name: Drachaku
notes:
Notes
It can only be obtained since the 2016 Winter Update.

name: Dragon Hammer
notes:
Notes
The Dragon Hammer is notoriously heavy for low-level knights to carry, yet it remains a popular choice because of its reasonable price.

name: Dragonbone Staff
notes:
Notes
It can only be wielded properly by players of level 30 or higher.

name: Draining Inferniarch Flail
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Flail.
None of the Draining Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Vampirism.

name: Draining Inferniarch Warhammer
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained from the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Warhammer.
None of the Draining Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Vampirism.

name: Eldritch Warmace
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Energized Demonbone
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Falcon Mace
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)
notes:
Notes
When using this item, it turns temporarily into a Ferumbras' Staff (Enchanted) or a Ferumbras' Staff (Failed), and the Red Sparkles Effect  and the following message appear: Magical sparks whirl around the staff and suddenly it changes its appearance.
 See also: Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)/Statistics

name: Furry Club
notes:
Notes
It is the best one-handed club weapon for players between 20 and 24, tied in attack with Spiky Club.
It could be argued if the price difference between the two is too great, one could just pick the cheaper option, as usually by level 20, players should have a decent shield and the extra defense modifier shouldn't matter that much.
Before Summer Update 2008, Rashid used to buy this item for 500 gp.
Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Giant Smithhammer
notes:
Notes
It looks the same as a Battle Hammer, a Hammer of Mighty Cheating and a Trunkhammer.
Found in the Giant Smithhammer Quest. Also needed to complete Explorer Society Quest.

name: Gilded Eldritch Warmace
notes:
Notes
It works just like a standard Eldritch Warmace.

name: Glooth Club
notes:
Notes
Breaks after 2 hits (this includes physical spells).Can be obtained by using a Glooth Bag.

name: Glooth Whip
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Glutton's Mace
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Doctor Perhaps to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
Looks the same as Meat. Beware of scams!

There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Grand Sanguine Bludgeon
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet dropped by Bakragore when fighting him under the influence of Bakragore's Burden.

name: Grand Sanguine Cudgel
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet dropped by Bakragore when fighting him under the influence of Bakragore's Burden.

name: Hammer of Destruction
notes:
Notes
Yana will trade you one for 50 Gold Tokens.

name: Hammer of Prophecy
notes:
Notes
It is one of the best club weapons. It can be seen under a Flash Arrow in Pythius the Rotten's treasure room. First looted by players in Guardia.

name: Hammer of Wrath
notes:
Notes
Formerly exclusively dropped by Ashmunrah, the price of this weapon decreased significantly with the introduction of Plaguesmiths - turning it into arguably the most common of the Pharaoh Rares.

name: Heavy Mace
notes:
Notes
This is an item not seen frequently.

name: Inferniarch Flail
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be used in the Doomforge to be turned into either a Siphoning Inferniarch Flail, Rending Inferniarch Flail, or Draining Inferniarch Flail.

name: Inferniarch Warhammer
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be used in the Doomforge to be turned into either a Siphoning Inferniarch Warhammer, Rending Inferniarch Warhammer, or Draining Inferniarch Warhammer.

name: Iron Hammer
notes:
Notes
Looks the same as the Snake Destroyer. 

Obtainable in the Iron Hammer Quest.

name: Jade Hammer
notes:
Notes
Rare club Weapon, mainly used for decoration purposes.

name: Jungle Flail
notes:
Notes
Part of the Jungle Set.

name: Lich Staff
notes:
Notes
You can see it in treasure room in Ferumbras Tower. Liches carry this staff but they do not drop these. This is believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

name: Life Preserver
notes:
Notes
New item implemented in the Winter Update 2012. It looks like a shovel used to dig and bury.

name: Light Mace
notes:
Notes
Apparently unobtainable. It was previously known as the Golden Mace.

name: Lion Hammer
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Lunar Staff
notes:
Notes
Its value can raise because of its rarity.

name: Mace of Destruction
notes:
Notes
Yana will trade you one for 50 Gold Tokens.

name: Mace
notes:
Notes
The Mace is one of the most commonly used Rookgaard weapons, and is often an abundant item in large loot bags on the Mainland. It is often dropped by Skeletons and it's easy to sell in Rookgaard, since it's the best club weapon there.

name: Maimer
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Mallet Handle
notes:
Notes
Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest.

name: Mammoth Whopper
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Metal Bat
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Moohtant Cudgel
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Morning Star
notes:
Notes
The Morning Star might be useful for players who cannot afford a Clerical Mace yet. It's the second best club weapon for players below level 20, taking level restrictions into account.

name: Mortal Mace
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Mycological Mace
notes:
Notes
It is the third best one-handed Club Weapon, but the second best obtainable one. Due to the lack of club users, the intended equivalents Shiny Blade and Crystalline Axe are much more expensive than the mycological mace.

name: Naga Club
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Northern Star
notes:
Notes
This was an Unobtainable Item for several years until January 7, 2017, when players were able to do the First Dragon Quest as part of Tibia's 20th Anniversary celebrations and loot it from a related creature.

name: Obsidian Truncheon
notes:
Notes
It has the same attributes as the Arcane Staff, but is one-handed. Really cheap in worlds where Annihilon is hunted frequently. 
Reward from The Inquisition Quest.

name: Ogre Klubba
notes:
Notes
It can be sold to NPC Mugruu after finishing Vuzrog's questline.Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: One Hit Wonder
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Onyx Flail
notes:
Notes
Used to be rare loot only found in Annihilon, but as of Update 8.4 it can now also be gotten from Hellspawns and since Update 10.37 from Hellhounds as well.

name: Orcish Maul
notes:
Notes
Reward from the Arena, Greenhorn level.

name: Ornate Mace
notes:
Notes
On most servers, this weapon is very cheap for its level requirement. The closest commonly available clubs would be either the Demonbone (level 80+) or the Obsidian Truncheon (level 100+), both of which are dropped by Annihilon and significantly more expensive. Part of the Ornate Set.

name: Pair of Iron Fists
notes:
Notes
The name is misleading - they are actually Club Weapons. They're not often used as weapons since War Hammers are much more common and has the same attack value. They're more likely to be seen used as decoration.

name: Queen's Sceptre
notes:
Notes
Used to be only dropped by Yakchal, but after the Winter Update 2008, it also became dropped by Infernalists and Ferumbras. Seems that after the 9.2 Update, it was removed from Infernalists loot.

name: Rending Inferniarch Flail
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Flail.
None of the Rending Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Strike.

name: Rending Inferniarch Warhammer
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained from the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Warhammer.
None of the Rending Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Strike.

name: Resizer
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Rotten Demonbone
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Sanguine Bludgeon
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Sanguine Cudgel
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Sapphire Hammer
notes:
Notes
The best level 30 one-handed club weapon, but is also the most expensive.

name: Scythe
notes:
Notes
This weapon/tool is used to cut wheat found in wheat fields. Needed to access The Secret Library, you'll need to use a Scythe on the monument located to the right of the altar found here.
You can use the Squeezing Gear of Girlpower as a substitution for this tool.

name: Shadow Sceptre
notes:
Notes
Club weapon. Its value dropped greatly due to the fact that it is now dropped by Nightmare Scion and NPC selleable. This is the best (obtainable) one handed Club weapon to use from level 35 to level 48, where the Deepling Squelcher  becomes available.

name: Silver Mace
notes:
Notes
It has been rumoured that some players in Premia, Secura and Antica have found this item through a quest in earlier days, but this has not been possible to confirm.

name: Siphoning Inferniarch Flail
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Flail.
None of the Siphoning Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Void.

name: Siphoning Inferniarch Warhammer
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained from the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Warhammer.
None of the Siphoning Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Void.

name: Skull Staff
notes:
Notes
In the past the Skull Staff was the weapon of choice for mages and for club users as it was not only light but it was the best available one handed club weapon, before the Summer Update 2007 and the introduction of the Barbarian Arena Quest.
It is obtained through the Medusa Shield Quest.

name: Skullcrusher
notes:
Notes
It has the same Attack and Defense as The Stomper, but is heavier and its level requirement is lower.

name: Snake God's Sceptre
notes:
Notes
Probably the first one was looted on unitera by Roff master and Shooter spod Biedronki

With Roff master and Shooter spod Biedronki

name: Soulcrusher
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Club Weapons in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Soulmaimer
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Club Weapons in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Spiked Squelcher
notes:
Notes
Good two-handed club for lvl 30 knights. It can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Spiky Club
notes:
Notes
It is the second best club weapon for levels 20-24, outclassed by the Furry Club.
It usually is more readily available than the former and moderately cheaper.

name: Staff
notes:
Notes
It looks like Simon the Beggar's Favourite Staff.

name: Stale Bread of Ancientness
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Mephiles to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It's the lightest Club Weapon in the game together with the Club of the Fury.
Looks the same as Bread and Garlic Bread.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Strange Mallet
notes:
Notes
This item can be obtained by asking Gnominimus to put together its three parts: a Mallet Pommel, a Mallet Handle and a Mallet Head.
Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest. When used on a Gong you will hear a BOOOOOOOONG! and the Mallet will be destroyed.

name: Studded Club
notes:
Notes
A slightly stronger version of the Club. Useful to players on Rookgaard who want to specialize in Clubs but have not yet gotten a Mace. Part of the Studded Set.

name: Sulphurous Demonbone
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Swampling Club
notes:
Notes
A rather useless club, marginally better than a Mace, it mostly just exists to be looted and sold to NPCs for money.

name: Taurus Mace
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: The Stomper
notes:
Notes
Can be seen behind Harog in Beregar. It used to be one of the best Two-handed clubs in the game, but nowadays its value is mostly due to its rarity.

name: Thunder Hammer
notes:
Notes
    The TH of Solera.  
The Demon bosses Orshabaal and Morgaroth drop it. It was for a long time the third best one-handed Club Weapon available. After the latest updates this club weapon has been more available since you can loot it in the mighty demons surfacing from the abyss. Every demon boss so far has proved to drop it. Also note that even though it's one handed it's the second heaviest club weapon in game.

name: Umbral Hammer
notes:
Notes
This weapon can only be imbued with Basic imbuements. Intricate and Powerful imbuements are not available for  Crude and Regular Umbral weapons.
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Umbral Mace
notes:
Notes
This weapon can only be imbued with Basic imbuements. Intricate and Powerful imbuements are not available for  Crude and Regular Umbral weapons.
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Umbral Master Hammer
notes:
Notes
It's currently the club weapon with the highest physical attack. For more information, see also Umbral Creation.

name: Umbral Master Mace
notes:
Notes
Currently the strongest obtainable one-handed club weapon. See also Umbral Creation.

name: Unliving Demonbone
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: War Hammer
notes:
Notes
Used to be used by most club fighters to cause heavy damage. Has lost most of its usefulness since the Summer Update 2007, since the level required for proper use is now 50. It looks the same as a Worm Punisher.
Obtainable from the Circle Room Quest.

name: Zathroth' Redeemer
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.
